Jeffery L. and I are so excited to welcome Mackenzie Maio to the Assort Health team as our newest GTM Recruiter.

Kenzie joins us with nearly two years of GTM recruiting experience and five years in sales. Kenzie has a proven track record of building AE teams from the ground up and scaling SDR organizations, bringing a rare blend of recruiting expertise and firsthand sales perspective.

Kenzie‚Äôs background gives her a unique ability to understand both the needs of candidates and the demands of high-growth GTM teams. She‚Äôs passionate about creating exceptional candidate experiences and is driven by Assort‚Äôs mission to expand patient access for all.

I‚Äôm hiring two Product Managers to work directly with me at as we scale Assort OS.

We‚Äôve successfully evolved from the first generative AI for healthcare call centers into a comprehensive clinical operating system. 

With the core infrastructure already built and operational, we are now in a high-growth phase: scaling the platform and launching a new suite of products to manage the entire patient journey.

The Role: You‚Äôll be joining a tiger team that executes with extreme speed and massive impact. This isn't just about maintaining features; it‚Äôs about 0-to-1 ownership as we expand our ecosystem to automate complex clinical and administrative workflows.

Why join us?
- Direct Impact: You will have the responsibility and ownership to build products that influence the care of millions of patients at scale.
- Velocity: We prioritize fast execution and zero bureaucracy.
- Founding Culture: You will work directly with me to shape the future of AI in healthcare.

If you are a builder who thrives in a high-autonomy environment and is ready to ship the next generation of healthcare infrastructure, let‚Äôs talk.

author.headline: Leveraging AI to make exceptional healthcare accessible anytime, anywhere, for anyone

data.text:
It's energizing to see the real-world impact of our platform featured in Healthcare IT News. A huge thank you to the publication and especially to Dr. Titus Abraham of Annapolis Internal Medicine LLC for illustrating why we're building what we're building at Assort Health.

As Dr. Abraham shared: "We started with annual flu shot reminders ‚Äì we now can report that 61% of flu shot appointments were booked through agentic AI outreach ... The technology is now embedded in our daily operations. Staff depend on it to manage core administrative workflows, while patients interact with it for everything from scheduling to receiving reminders."

I'm incredibly proud of my team at Assort, and of what our partnership with Annapolis Internal Medicine is accomplishing.

#TechItToTheLimit #YourRxforLOL #BonusEpisode #HealthTechPodcast #HealthcareInnovation #DigitalHealth #HLTH #HLTHConference #HealthTech #HealthIT #Podcasting #Humor #Medicine #Healthcare #HealthAI #PatientExperience #AgenticAI Sarah Harper, MA, MBA Elliott Wilson, MBA, PMP Flying Pig Consulting

Looking back on 2025, if I had to choose one thing that made a difference it was implementing Voice AI.
¬†
Last year, we integrated Assort Health‚Äôs voice AI into our scheduling workflow. Going into it, I was looking for efficiency‚Äîa software solution to handle the easy things like appointment confirmations and rescheduling.
¬†
What I found was a competitive advantage that exceeded my initial expectations. Technology is moving fast and this specific implementation was a standout. The partnership was highly valuable.

Where will we be one year from now? I'm excited to see where else AI can take us. What will be the biggest technology impact for physician practices in 2026? Personally, I think we'll see AI move from "handling the phones" to "ambient clinical support". Enabling doctors more time to focus on the patient rather than admin is what we all want. Let tech, where proven, handle the rest.
¬†
Happy to share the details of what I learned - feel free to direct message me.
¬†
Artificial Intelligence HealthTech Healthcare Assort Health

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - specialty-trained voice AI to answer patient calls

data.text:
In 2021, I left medical school with nothing but a few crazy ideas and a burning passion to improve patient access. 

Fast forward to today: We're honored to partner with incredible healthcare organizations that choose Assort Health to be the patient's first call‚Äînow powering over 70 million interactions for thousands of providers. 

In 2023, when we launched the first agentic AI to address specialty scheduling, we discovered that the hardest part wasn't the AI model. Rather, it was all the edge cases and nuances important to every patient's journey. Our partners use Assort to deliver personalized experiences that feel seamless to patients and are easily customized to provider-specific needs.  

I am proud of how far this team has come and even more energized by the next chapter, which will introduce new capabilities that enable us to understand patients more deeply than anyone else so we can best support their journey. 

Thank you, Forbes, for the recognition, and to our team, partners, and community for believing in our mission.

Read the full story below.

#HealthIT #AgenticAI #PatientExperience

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - specialty-trained voice AI to answer patient calls

resharedPost.text:
From pushing wheelchairs to processing 70M interactions.

My healthcare journey didn‚Äôt start in a boardroom. It started in high school, volunteering as a patient transporter. I spent my days pushing patients in and out of the health system, delivering lab results, and bringing gifts from families to bedside.

I fell in love with serving patients and saw firsthand how critical those interactions are.

That early experience is the DNA of Assort Health. It‚Äôs why I am so incredibly proud of our team; which has grown from just 7 people last year to 70 people today. Together, our platform has now handled over 70 million patient interactions. ¬† 

We are building AI with the empathy I learned on the hospital floor.

With our new capabilities, we are moving beyond just answering the phone. We are launching proactive agentic campaigns to close care gaps, reaching out to patients to schedule things like annual physicals and flu shots rather than waiting for them to react to health needs. ¬† 

We are also deploying "Agent Memory" to ensure every conversation feels personal. Our system uses past interactions to predict a patient's needs: remembering if they prefer Spanish, adjusting speaking speed, or modulating voice tone to be more empathetic based on the context. ¬† 

But modern patient access isn't just about voice. We are meeting patients where they are by expanding into chatbots and 2-way texting. We are also fixing the hidden friction in the background with our new referral orchestration and document processing platforms, ensuring that critical data is ingested automatically so patients get the care they need faster. ¬† 

Thank you, Forbes, for the 30 Under 30 recognition. This is for the team, our partners, and the patients we serve.

We‚Äôre just getting started.

One of the fastest growing companies in agentic AI, Assort Health, is now #hiring for a Chief Medical Informatics Officer. This team is exceptional and of all the AI companies committed to making a difference for healthcare organizations, they're one of the few with strong validated outcomes on critical workflows...driving material cost savings and revenue gains.

Since launching the first #agentic #AI for specialty scheduling in 2023, Assort has managed over 70M+ patient interactions for thousands of providers in 20 different specialties. In the past few months, they‚Äôve raised over $100M to go extremely deep in building impactful partnerships with top #healthcare organizations.  

Having had the chance to work closely with them, I've been incredibly impressed by how intent they are on getting all the details right, specialty by specialty.  It's how they've achieved industry leading resolution rates, fully automating complex patient communications end-to-end.

This role will directly shape how they scale into large healthcare organizations and ensure their offerings resonate with clinical and operational leaders across the country. They‚Äôre looking for a practicing or recently practicing physician with clinical informatics experience, strong EMR fluency, and the commercial mindset to engage effectively with health system leaders.

If this sounds like you, or someone you know, please reach out!

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - Specialty-specific voice AI to answer patient calls
Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - specialty-trained voice AI to answer patient calls

resharedPost.text:
A patient's journey shouldn't start with hold music. It‚Äôs a universal sign of inefficiency, frustrating for patients and the staff trying to help them. While adding more staff or basic chatbots offers a temporary fix, these solutions don't address the deep-rooted complexity of healthcare operations.

The real solution lies in smarter systems. Our co-CEO Jon Wang wrote about this for Becker's Healthcare exploring the difference between general "AI in healthcare" and purpose-built "AI for healthcare." Agentic AI, trained on millions of specialty-specific patient interactions, can understand the nuanced workflows of a practice ‚Äî from provider preferences to insurance rules.

When AI seamlessly handles front-office complexities, staff can focus on high-value work and patients can access the care they need, when they need it. At Assort Health, we're seeing our partners reduce wait times from over an hour to under 30 seconds and cut call abandonment rates by more than half.

Let's hang up on hold music for good. Read more in the full article. 

https://lnkd.in/gxbEShGh

#PatientAccess #AgenticAI #HealthIT

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - specialty-trained voice AI to answer patient calls

data.text:
The phone is still healthcare‚Äôs front door. Right now it‚Äôs jammed.

Honored to share a deep-dive from Nikhil Krishnan at Out-Of-Pocket on what we‚Äôre building at Assort Health and why appointment scheduling is so hard. I‚Äôve followed Nikhil‚Äôs work for years, so this partnership and write-up mean a lot (thank you)!

A few highlights from his piece:

- Why scheduling breaks: matching reason and urgency to the right clinician, insurance rules, room/equipment needs, and multi-step visits like ‚Äúultrasound then OB,‚Äù all at once.
- What Assort does: agentic AI across voice, text, email, and web that triages, verifies insurance, schedules or escalates, and runs proactive outreach for waitlists and care gaps.
- Real results he cites: at OrthoIndy, 131% labor capacity increase, 38% labor cost reduction, and hold times cut from about an hour to roughly 30 seconds.


If you‚Äôre a practice leader or operator, this is a clear look under the hood. He also includes a reader perk and discount :)  

Full article link in the comments.

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - specialty-trained voice AI to answer patient calls

data.text:
What happens when healthcare leaders at the top of their game get honest about what it really takes to build trust in agentic AI? You get a candid, fruitful discussion‚Äîone I was thrilled to take part in. Yesterday‚Äôs discussion during Becker's Healthcare ‚ÄúAI in the C‚ÄëSuite‚Äù panel reinforced a core belief we hold at Assort Health: for AI to succeed in healthcare, trust must be earned operationally, not rhetorically. 

I'm still thinking about the insights brought to life by my fellow panelists:

Lisa Fino, Chief Access Officer and Patient Experience Officer at Temple Health, noted that trust is built operationally, not rhetorically. She shared how her team dropped call abandonment from 35% to 2% by redesigning access and bringing patients into the process. 

Lisa also noted that we must aim beyond ‚Äúhappy paths." Healthcare has infinite exceptions, and reliability comes from how systems handle the 1-in-50 scenario. Edge cases are where the real work happens.

Tim Getsay, EVP, Integration and Performance, Gillette Children‚Äôs Specialty Healthcare and Dr Abha Agrawal MD, FACP, FACHE,  Founder, President & CEO, NorthStar Hospitals both emphasized using AI where risk is lower first. Empathy remains human; AI is assistive.

Dr. Agrawal made the critical point that outcomes matter more than demos, sharing real-world examples like automated sepsis alerts and care-gap outreach that have made a big impact on results. 

Both Dr. Agrawal and Tim provided a crucial budget reality check: tech spend varies wildly (‚âà3‚Äì10%). Vendors must share risk and prove a dark-green ROI, not just shift costs.

The takeaway is clear: the winners in this space will have a commitment to transparent AI with a human in the loop, measured outcomes, and shared-risk ROI. Trust has to be earned.

They'd understand the triage rules, understand which doctors wanted to see which kind of patients with what insurance on which day ‚Ä¶ You can only learn that by getting that deeply embedded in the practice." - Roy Rosin, First Round Capital 

At Assort Health, we're committed to deeply embedding ourselves in customers' practices to understand their unique workflows, organizational nuances, and patient needs. Why? Because it's the only way to ensure agentic AI delivers the value healthcare providers expect and the experience their patients deserve.

data.text:
I‚Äôm excited to join Becker's Healthcare's CEO + CFO Roundtable in Chicago to speak on AI in the C-Suite: Strategic Applications for Healthcare Leaders. I‚Äôll be sharing how specialty-trained voice AI agents are transforming healthcare operations and patient experience.

üìÖ Tuesday, November 4 | 9:20‚Äì10:00 AM

üìç Hilton Chicago, 720 S Michigan Ave, Chicago, IL 60605

I‚Äôll be on a panel with:

‚Ä¢  Dr Abha Agrawal MD, MD, FACP, FACHE ‚Äì Founder, President & CEO, NorthStar Hospitals

‚Ä¢  Lisa Fino ‚Äì Chief Access Officer and Patient Experience Officer, Temple Health

‚Ä¢  Tim Getsay ‚Äì EVP, Integration and Performance, Gillette Children‚Äôs Specialty Healthcare

I‚Äôm proud of what we‚Äôre building and grateful to do it with this group. We‚Äôre growing rapidly and looking for people to join our next luau photo!

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - specialty-trained voice AI to answer patient calls

resharedPost.text:
‚ÄúWe want to have fuller schedules and more total patient visits, and that‚Äôs exactly what we achieved. It gives us a really compelling advantage.‚Äù - Michael Haberkorn, Director Business Development, Michigan Orthopaedic Surgeons.

At Assort Health, that‚Äôs the kind of impact we aim to deliver for every partner practice. By automating scheduling and patient communication through our agentic AI platform, providers are seeing fewer no-shows, reduced call abandonment, and fuller calendars ‚Äì all while giving patients faster, easier access to care.

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - specialty-trained voice AI to answer patient calls

data.text:
‚ÄúWe went from hour and a half, hour and 45 minute wait times, down to less than 30 seconds,‚Äù says Matt Penrose, Director of Clinical Services at Peninsula Orthopaedic Associates. ‚ÄúOur abandon rate was pushing 50% ‚Ä¶ Our abandon rate is mostly under 10% at this point since we transitioned to Assort.‚Äù 

We‚Äôre proud to see results like these within our partner practices. Assort Health is ensuring patients can reach their providers anytime, without waiting endlessly on hold or being passed from person to person. Our recent Series B raise will allow us to improve these key metrics further ‚Äì improving access, efficiency, and patient satisfaction through the continued development of Assort OS.

Staffing shortages are straining healthcare systems, but agentic AI is helping administrative teams work smarter, not harder. 

Last week, our co-founder and co-CEO Jon Wang joined Becker's Healthcare's 31st Annual Meeting: Business & Operations of ASCs to talk about how voice-enabled agentic AI is changing healthcare operations for patients and staff. 

At Assort Health, our AI is addressing common workflow challenges and amplifying staff impact by: 
- Completing tasks from start-to-finish ‚Äî from appointment booking to care gap outreach. 
- Improving patient experience ‚Äî reducing wait times and increasing access. 
- Earning patient trust ‚Äî satisfaction often exceeds human interactions once patients engage. 
- Integrating securely with EMRs ‚Äî while adapting to the guardrails and procedures of each practice. 

Read the full recap of the session here: https://lnkd.in/gg9fqc7k

Grateful to have taken part in an incredible discussion at AAO 2025 alongside Patrick Herde (Modernizing Medicine), Shriji Patel MD MBA (Genentech), and Jason Handza (Nextech) ‚Äî with thoughtful moderation by Julia Lee and Alexander de Castro-Abeger of the American Academy of Ophthalmology Board last weekend in Orlando. 

Our conversation centered on the role AI will play in shaping the future of ophthalmology and how we can deploy it responsibly to address one of the specialty‚Äôs biggest challenges: a growing shortage of clinicians. Nearly 30% of ophthalmologists are over the age of 65, and only a fraction are under 40. AI has a real opportunity to help fill those gaps by reducing administrative burden and helping practices run more efficiently while creating greater access to eye care. 

At Assort Health, we‚Äôre building agentic AI systems that do exactly that by providing instant, 24/7 access to care across channels and languages. Our mission is simple: no more dreaded hold music, no more waiting days to weeks for an appointment, just seamless access to the care patients need when they need it. 

A key takeaway from our discussion: agentic AI is powerful, but it isn‚Äôt infallible. That‚Äôs why human oversight and transparent, auditable systems are essential as we continue building toward a future where humans and AI work hand in hand to make healthcare simpler and more accessible for everyone. 

Thank you to AAO for bringing together such a forward-thinking group of leaders to discuss what‚Äôs next for AI in eye care.

data.text:
Jon Wang and I are thrilled to welcome Mariko Kelly to Assort Health as Director of Agent Deployment & Success!

Mariko joins us from Stanford Medicine, where she managed strategic initiatives with leading life sciences, venture, and healthcare organizations. She led multi-million dollar alliances, drove product innovation, and worked closely with executive teams to advance groundbreaking research programs. Earlier in her career, she worked at startups leading product operations and go-to-market strategy‚Äîgiving her a unique mix of startup execution and institutional scale.

At Assort, Mariko will lead how our technology comes to life for customers, ensuring each implementation delivers impact from day one. Her work will help our partners deploy more effectively, reach patients faster, and deliver better outcomes at scale. We can't wait to see the impact she'll make!

author.headline: Founder, co-CEO at Assort Health - Specialty-specific voice AI to answer patient calls

data.text:
We‚Äôre honored to be named to the 2025 #Disruptors60 list by Greenfield Partners and featured on TechCrunch

This list celebrates startups using AI to create meaningful real-world change. For us, that means using technology to make high-quality healthcare simple, fast, and available to everyone. 

At Assort Health, we‚Äôre focused on solving healthcare access at scale‚Äînot by replacing people, but by combining clinical expertise with AI that helps care teams move faster and smarter. 

We‚Äôre grateful to our patients, partners, and team for making this work possible. 

See the full list: www.disruptors60.ai

‚ÄúEvery physician practice and anyone in a medical practice knows it‚Äôs a seemingly endless queue of work. A tool that allows us to streamline and work efficiently is very much welcome, and that‚Äôs what Assort has been.‚Äù - Parinita Amin, MD, CEO of MDCS: Manhattan Dermatology and Cosmetic Surgery

Administrative overload is one of the biggest drivers of burnout in healthcare. By automating routine tasks like scheduling, call management, and follow-ups, Assort helps practices reclaim time for what matters most: patient care. 

We‚Äôre proud to partner with leaders like Dr. Amin who are using technology not just to improve access, but to create a better, more sustainable work environment for clinicians and staff.

companyMentions.name: MDCS: Manhattan Dermatology and Cosmetic Surgery

data.text:
‚ÄúWith our staff, which was outsourced, we could only handle daytime scheduling,‚Äù says Titus Abraham, MD, Annapolis Internal Medicine LLC. ‚ÄúNow our Assort system, our generative AI who we call Amy, is available 24/7. She never sleeps.‚Äù 

Healthcare doesn‚Äôt keep office hours, and neither does Assort Health‚Äôs agentic AI. By providing round-the-clock access, our platform is helping practices like Annapolis Internal Medicine ensure their patients can schedule appointments, get the answers they need, and connect with their care whenever it‚Äôs convenient for them. 

At Assort, we‚Äôre setting a new standard for what accessibility looks like in modern healthcare.

Here's a paradox we're seeing play out: our AI rates 4.6/5 stars with patients. But 30-40% ask for a representative the moment they hear it's AI. 

This came up in my conversation with Elliott Wilson, MBA, PMP from Tech It to the Limit at #HLTH2025, and it's the tension that defines healthcare AI right now. 

After 50M patient interactions, the pattern is clear: the technology works. We've built systems that handle 1.2M edge cases‚Äîthe kind of specialty-specific scheduling logic that lives in binders and spreadsheets. The AI can navigate a 73-day global period for a PCP cortisone injection vs 85 days for Cigna. It doesn't forget. It doesn't burn out answering 150 calls a day. 

But trust isn't built on capability alone. What we've learned: the win isn't replacing the human. It's giving the front desk staff their humanity back. When they're not buried in binder rules and EHR screens during a call, they can actually listen to a struggling patient. The machine handles the mundane. The human handles the moment that matters. 

That's the shift. Not AI vs human. AI + human. 

What trust barriers are you seeing with clinical AI adoption?

data.text:
Jon Wang and I are pumped to welcome Howard Yang to the Assort Health team as Agent Software Engineer.

Howard brings deep experience in engineering and data integrations, building tools that help organizations surface the information they care about most. At Expo, he worked with restaurant franchises to connect diverse technologies and apply AI insights to improve how their teams operated day to day. 

At Assort, Howard will apply that same attention to detail to developing systems that meet the complex, evolving requirements of our customers and ensure they operate with precision as we continue to grow. Can't wait to see all he'll accomplish here!

We're thrilled to be recognized on Redpoint's AI64 list, which highlights 64 private companies shaping AI applications. 

Proud to be in such outstanding company - congratulations to everyone listed!

https://lnkd.in/g2FfC76G

Grateful to the Becker's Healthcare team for hosting such an insightful ASC conference and to Jessica Lam of Pacific Coast Anesthesia and Sherman Nam Tran MD of Spine & Sports Surgery Center for an engaging discussion on responsible innovation. 

At Assort Health, we‚Äôve learned that success with Agentic AI begins small‚Äîthrough transparent, auditable workflows that deliver measurable results. From automating administrative tasks to improving patient access, these early wins pave the way for lasting impact. 

I was proud to share our journey from being the first to fully schedule a healthcare appointment over the phone with Agentic AI to now managing millions of patient interactions each year‚Äîeach one a step toward simpler, more accessible healthcare.

data.text:
‚ÄúWhen Jon Wang was on stage, he said, ‚ÄòThe mission and purpose of what we‚Äôre trying to do is people and patients.‚Äô As an investor, or even as someone watching this from afar, that‚Äôs what you want to hear from a founder ‚Äì that this is at the core of what they‚Äôre trying to build and do.‚Äù - Apolo Ohno, Eight-time Olympic champion and Assort Health investor 

Thank you, Apolo, for your confidence in Assort and our mission to make healthcare more accessible for everyone. 

With our recent Series B raise, we‚Äôre continuing to put patients and providers at the center of healthcare. We‚Äôre expanding our team and accelerating the development of Assort OS to improve the patient experience across every interaction. And we‚Äôre just getting started.

Jeffery L. and I are thrilled to welcome Lauren Chioma (Ogbogu) Knight to the Assort Health team as AI Solutions Director, Enterprise.

Lauren brings a strong record of performance and leadership across high-growth, investor-backed startups. At Builder.ai, she was the top U.S. performer, achieving a 40% conversion rate on all new business two years in a row. She also helped build new market segments, shape sales strategy, and lead hiring and training for the Inside Sales team.

She‚Äôs made an impact at companies like Facebook, Zendesk, and Glassdoor, and brings a sharp understanding of how to drive growth at scale. Lauren is a proud graduate from the University of Oregon and also holds a master‚Äôs from the University of San Francisco.

We‚Äôre excited to have her on board as we expand Assort‚Äôs enterprise AI solutions and strengthen our partnerships across the industry.
